items.content:
Software Automation Q.A. Engineer


Wallethub

 verified

Company details

WalletHub is one of the leading personal finance destinations in the US. We're looking for a motivated and experienced Automation QA Engineer for a full-time, permanent, remote position.

Ideal Candidate

You are the ideal candidate for this job if you have:


* At least 2 years experience in Test Automation with Java and Selenium

* At least 2 years experience in Manual Testing

* Excellent attention to details

* Ability & motivation to work a minimum of 55 hrs per week

* Proven ability to meet deadlines and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment

* Must stay up-to-date with developing technologies and showcase them in your work

* Proficient in written/spoken English




Responsibilities


* Testing and assuring high quality performance of website

* Reporting and validating bugs for all components

* Creating test plans and test cases

* Identify opportunities for improvement and make constructive suggestions for change




Our Offer


* Very competitive salary based on skills and prior experience

* Raise and advancement opportunities based on periodic evaluations

* Visa sponsorship (if outside the US sponsorship is granted after 24 months with the company, based on performance)




More about WalletHub

WalletHub is a high-growth fintech company based in Washington, D.C. that is looking for talented, hard-working individuals to help us reshape personal finance. More specifically, we are harnessing the power of data analytics and artificial intelligence to build the brain of a smart financial advisor, whose services we’re offering to everyone for free. The WalletHub brain enables users to make better financial decisions in a fraction of the time with three unique features:

1) Customized Credit-Improvement Tips: WalletHub identifies improvement opportunities and guides you through the necessary corrections.

2) Personalized Money-Saving Advice: WalletHub’s savings brain constantly scours the market for load-lightening opportunities, bringing you only the best deals.

3) Wallet Surveillance: Personal finance isn’t as scary with 24/7 credit monitoring providing backup, notifying you of important credit-report changes.

In addition to the valuable intelligence the brain provides, WalletHub is the first and only service to offer free credit scores and full credit reports that are updated on a daily basis absent of user interaction, rather than weekly or monthly and only when a user logs in. Some other services hang their hats on free credit scores and reports, yet they’re still inferior to what WalletHub considers minor pieces to a much larger puzzle.

How to Apply

To get our attention, all you need to do is send us a resume. If we believe that you will be a good match, we'll contact you to arrange the next steps. You can apply on Stackoveflow or email your application to jobs.dev@wallethub.com

Note: This position does not have a location requirement and can be performed either remotely (including from outside the U.S.). Please also be aware this position entails working at least 55 hours per week and requires an overlap with EST business hours.

See more jobs at Wallethub

Job Description

We are looking for senior developers to join the team at Enki (front-end, back-end, full-stack or mobile).

Summary:

We are a fast-growing early-stage company backed by top investors and with a founder who has built two $100m+ valuation companies before.

Our mission is to organize the world's professional knowledge, and in doing so reinvent how learning and employee development is done in the workplace.

Since our launch in Q1 2016, almost 1 million developers have downloaded our first product - a mobile to level up tech skills. We're soon going to launch other products to help improve tech skills of individuals and teams.

We have a clear path to building the biggest community of developers, collaborating around learning and staying ahead of the tech curve.

What does "Senior" really mean:

- A desire to commit to continuous learning, and help other devs do the same.
- Wide-ranging skillset and impressive experience in open-source or professional software development.
- Full-stack JavaScript and/or mobile with core linux and devops skills- you need to be able to deploy to AWS.
- Experience or interest for data analysis, data extraction and machine learning.
- Entrepreneurial mindset, taking initiative and contributing to the vision.
- Flexible, able to iterate and adapt to fast-changing contexts.
- Desire and capability to own and improve a portion of our codebase.
- Generalist and eager to learn and work with a lot of different technologies.

Key benefits:

- Huge impact potential: changing the way millions of people learn every day.
- Exceptional autonomy and decision power: you will be treated like a co-founder.
- Unique culture of experimentation and learning to fast-track your career.
- Generous equity, since you'll be part of the founding team.
- Compensation and perks in line with high-end technology companies.

Thanks for your interest! Get in touch with the CTO (liz@enki.com) if you'd like to find out more.

items.content:
*Hello, we’re Cornerstone*
We sell our own high-quality range of grooming, wellbeing and dental products on a flexible, regular subscription at cornerstone.co.uk. Having started from our founder’s kitchen table with a £5,000 loan, we now have 170,000 subscribers around the UK and a team of 30 in our London HQ.

*What we’re looking for*
Operations is crucial to delivering the best service for our members. We’re looking for a hands-on, enthusiastic person, who can keep things running both day-to-day and when the unexpected strikes.

*What you’ll be doing*
* You will maintain regular oversight of the existing stock level in our warehouses.
* You will effectively manage the relationship with our warehouses to ensure our SLAs are met.
* You will work with suppliers and warehouses to improve supply chain efficiency.
* Although you will be working hard to minimise glitches, you will be responsible for handling any crisis with calm and control.
* You will cooperate closely with Tech, Brand and Products to launch new products and improve existing ones.
* You will work with the Finance Team at the end of every month to assist month-end closure.
* You will perform ad-hoc quantitative operational analysis.

*A bit more about you*
* You are organised and detail-oriented.
* You’re motivated, eager to learn and willing to go the extra mile.
* You’re able to prioritise different tasks and workload demands (distinguishing between important and urgent).
* You’re capable of building and managing relationships with a variety of stakeholders.
* You have a good working knowledge of Excel and other Office packages.
* You are an excellent verbal and written communicator.
* Ideally, you are experienced in supply chain management (not essential).
* Ideally, you have an understanding of databases and SQL (not essential).

*Interview process*
* Application with your CV and a _brief_ email introducing yourself and your relevant experience.
* Phone interview.
* A task to complete from home.
* Face-to-face interview with members of the Operations team.
* Face-to-face interview with our founder Ollie.

*On inclusivity*
We’re building a working environment and recruitment process that is open to all sections of society. We’re committed to providing equal opportunities for employment regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic origin, disability, family structure, socio-economic status, age, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis (it's the law, but it also matters to us).

If you have a disability, caring duties, or any other additional need that require considerations, accommodation or adjustments to our role or recruitment process, please do let us know. And if you have suggestions on how we could improve, we’d really like to hear from you.

*What we’re offering*
* £25,000 per annum
* A £5,000 bonus discretionary bonus in quarterly instalments subject to satisfactory performance
* Company pension
* Flexible working
* 25 days of holiday plus Bank Holidays
* 1 paid day per year to volunteer with a charity of your choice
* Personal learning and development budget of £300 per year
* A great office in London Bridge/ Borough, filled with snacks and drinks
* Shower and a Cycle to Work scheme
* Regular team lunches and fun nights out
* Apple laptop

items.content:
Project Lead, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning

Company: World Economic Forum LLC
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA

San Francisco, CA

The Centre for the Fourth Industrial Revolution (“the Centre”) brings together policy leaders and strategists of international, national and sub-national bodies with technology pioneers, business leaders, academic experts from leading universities, and civil society representatives to study emerging technologies, address the resulting transformations and test protocols and policies that could harness and accelerate the benefits of these technologies whilst minimizing their potential disruptive impacts. This multi-stakeholder hub provides policy leaders with the unique opportunity to anticipate and shape the trajectory of emerging technologies.
The Centre in San Francisco is looking for a Project Lead for the Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Project.
Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning are already impacting governments, enterprises, institutions, and individuals in multiple ways, and will have increasingly complex and far-reaching consequences in the coming years. The Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Project aims to create policy and governance frameworks that will be piloted by governments and other stakeholders around the world in order to shape the trajectory of emerging technologies so that they benefit society.
The Project Lead will work with the Project Head to define and progress the Project and the team aligned to the Project (3 to 5 people), working closely with the Forum System Initiative on Shaping the Future of Digital Economy and Society. The Project Lead will help facilitate collaboration across other Centre projects such as autonomous vehicles, civilian use of drones, environment, Internet of Things (IoT), digital trade and cross border data flows, and blockchain. The Project Lead will help to facilitate engagement across the Forum's existing global communities of business executives, leading academicians from the world's top research universities, government officials, start-up community, media, civil society organizations, social entrepreneurs, and Centre Partners which include salesforce, Microsoft, Kaiser Permanente, SAP, Palantir, Huawei, IDEO, Reliance Industries, and Turkcell.

The position is based in San Francisco.

Duties and Responsibilities:
In each phase of the project help to:
  • Drive global survey and mapping of already existing work on Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning and define gaps in current policy frameworks
  • Define the issue(s) and policy-related questions to be investigated on Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, identify clear opportunities for impact, set the goals for the project, and establish clear evaluation criteria
  • Utilizing user-centered design, lead the development of policy and governance frameworks and the deployment of pilots with partner governments and other stakeholders
  • Select, engage, and coordinate public and private partners from industry, government, academia, international organizations and civil society in the initiation, leadership and management of the project
  • Drive effective project delivery, integration, and coordination, through a highly collaborative approach and effective resourcing, budgeting, project and process management, communication, and reporting
  • Manage in-person and virtual teams
  • Support and deliver the project review and approval by sponsors and project review committees
  • Drive the deployment and utilisation of digital interactive tools for project communities
  • Depending on the phase of the project, the role will entail a combination of the above or more focus on certain responsibilities.

Qualifications and Skills:
  • Masters (or higher) degree in Public Policy Management, Artificial Intelligence or other technology, or similar fields
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in private or public sector, including working on or consulting on relevant Artificial Intelligence related topics
  • Experience crafting public policy on Artificial Intelligence (such as regulations, standards, guidelines or other policy tools), ideally inside or with governments or global organizations
  • Deep knowledge of the Artificial Intelligence ecosystem, including key governing bodies, decision makers, and scholars
  • Proven track record on thought leadership regarding Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, including published articles, speeches/presentations in international forums, and conference participation
  • Comfort driving entrepreneurial projects, starting new teams, and identifying opportunities for impact in crowded spaces
  • Ability to design and drive medium to large-scale project design and delivery
  • Successful experience in engaging global leaders from the private and/or public sector
  • Ability to quickly develop a meaningful perspective on internal and external issues that have organisational impact
  • Strong leadership skills with the ability to manage and motivate high performing, dispersed teams through volatility, uncertainty, complexity, risk and ambiguity
  • Excellent presentation and facilitation skills
  • Excellent verbal and written language skills in English; verbal proficiency in other languages would be an asset
  • Proficient with recent digital platforms

Apply for this position

http://chk.tbe.taleo.net/chk06/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=WEFORUM&cws=41&rid=244&source=Futurejobs.io

items.content:
Blockchain Engineer

Location: Remote New York NYC
Role and job type: Full-time

Job Description

ĀTO Platform is a unique exchange for fine art artists and patrons to come together, learn, invest, and create. We can guarantee that there is no art - tech company in the world like ours, and we want your help to build it. We are ready to build our MVP DApp on the Ethereum blockchain. Our trading dashboard should be minimalist and intuitive. We want a crypto exchange as the center of the app, a front-end UI, Admin console, a crypto wallet as a daemon on the exchange, and a trading engine.

  • Research and drive high-level decisions about ĀTO Platform architecture, incentive structures, and features, potentially using 0x to build out the MVP
  • Spec, implement, test, and audit protocol upgrades and additions
  • Work effectively with a high degree of autonomy, within a collaboratively minded team
  • Keep abreast of the nascent and rapidly evolving blockchain space, and introduce innovative functionality
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with other teams, including engineering (internal and external), research, data science, product management, executive leadership, and recruiting
    eventually, gather and analyze ĀTO Platform usage statistics to identify and prioritize areas for improvement
  • Be a steward and influencer of our early engineering culture

Requirements

  • Experience in Solidity and DApp development
  • Deep understanding of blockchain technology and cryptoeconomic protocols
  • Strong knowledge of market structures and exchange related concepts
  • Ability to write very high quality, well-tested code
  • Passion for the benefits of decentralization and the ĀTO Platform/Gallery mission
  • The ability to learn and adapt to a rapidly evolving tech stack
  • 4+ years of experience in software engineering
  • API writing skills
  • Expertise in building distributed applications and systems using C++ (required)
  • Solid understanding of distributed systems principles, algorithms, and data structures (required)
    Literacy with cryptographic principles and practices (required)

Experience in one or more of the following:

  • Cryptocurrency protocols, blockchains, smart contracts.
  • Financial technology
  • User experience and web applications
  • Infrastructure related development

Benefits

  • Additional compensation in ĀTO tokens
  • Comprehensive insurance (medical/dental/vision) after launch
  • Monthly mobile phone bill and transportation reimbursement after launch
  • Great office conveniently located in Manhattan NY
  • Work remotely if you want
  • Be treated like an adult and equal team member, always
  • Invitations to exclusive art events, parties, and galas in New York, Miami, Los Angeles, London, Paris, and Tokyo, just to start.
  • Take vacation when you need it
  • Opportunity to build an exciting product with global reach and huge potential
  • Freedom to make technical / design decisions and to implement your vision of development process
  • Opportunity to have big impact on the product vision and the company
  • Opportunity to get further commercial experience in development for many different blockchains / cryptocurrencies including, but not limited to Bitcoin and Ethereum
  • Sweat equity proportional to your effort
  • Co-founding opportunity
  • Competitive salary after funding or revenue, hourly pay for MVP
  • Potentially much higher salary than listed below if CTO/Co-founder level of experience

ĀTO Platform is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity at our company and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Salary range

80-200K PLUS TOKEN

items.content:
Data Engineer 

Location: London, Liverpool St

Why you should join us

We’ve built up a team of outstanding and passionate people, and we work hard to keep them. Of course there’s plenty of flexibility and lots of opportunities to grow, but we also have share options, private health insurance, and unlimited leave (with a minimum of 5.6 weeks per year - just so everyone actually takes time off). Our CEO is (really) devoted to making Rotageek the best place to work, and so while we work really, really hard, we definitely play hard, too. And we have nice snacks, good beer, amazing team events and a roof terrace.

Your role 

We’re looking for someone who will work closely with our Data Science/Engineering teams to maintain operational and reporting data processes for our clients. You’ll be responsible for importing and exporting data from our databases, data migrations, reporting as well as maintenance and support of existing data projects. This role is a great opportunity for someone who not only wants to solve problems (writing SQL will be a significant part of this role) but is also interested in being exposed to some exciting Data Science work with an opportunity to get more involved in this area over time.

Rotageek 

A few years ago, Rotageek was a small side project; our CEO, an A&E doctor, wanted to improve scheduling in his hospital department. Today, we’re a software company leading the way in reinventing how employees are scheduled. We’re helping some of the largest UK organisations move from paper and excel based rotas to intelligent and interactive schedules. In doing so, we’re helping employees gain more ownership over their hours - improving their work-life balance - whilst making sure that businesses improve how they run their operations. We use intelligent technology to make sure the right staff are in the right place at the right time, whilst making the process of creating, communicating and modifying a rota as easy as possible.

What we expect from our Data Engineer

  • You’ll be able to communicate with our clients to develop and support imports and exports from Rotageek
  • You’ll be able to easily create and edit custom reports so customers can view their data in different formats
  • You’ll work closely with our Customer Success team ensuring that everything is in place from a technical implementation perspective for rollouts and trials

As the ideal candidate, you...

  • Have experience working with SQL (plus if it is SQL Server)
  • Are familiar with the most common structured or delimited file formats (CSV, XML, JSON, etc)
  • Are familiar with data transfer methods (SFTP, HTTP, TCP, SOAP, REST, etc)
  • Ideally are familiar with ETL Tools and Python
  • Are eager to work for a high-growth tech company. It comes with lots of benefits and opportunities, but it’s not for everyone.

Apply! If you think this sounds like something you’d enjoy and excel at, we would love to hear from you! To apply, please send us your CV and a short paragraph explaining why you think you’d make a great Data Engineer to claire@rotageek.com We look forward to hearing from you!

(We’re not looking to work with recruiters for this job posting so please only contact us if you’re a candidate wishing to apply - thank you!)

items.content:
Data Engineer // Idagio

Company: Idagio

Tags:
  • Business Intelligence
  • Data
  • music

    • ABOUT US

    “This startup is set to revolutionize classical music” – Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung

    We are a technology company that is driven by the mission to build the world’s best streaming service for classical music lovers. We’re the only service worldwide that is able to offer the specialized search that lovers of this genre want and need. A search that they can’t and won’t get at Spotify, Apple Music or Youtube.

    We are honoured to also work directly with the world’s leading musicians and institutions, including the Vienna Philharmonic, the Philharmonia Orchestra and the Israel Philharmonic.

    IDAGIO is available to music lovers across the globe, but physically we are rooted in Berlin and consider the German-speaking countries our home base, as the world perceives them as the cradle and the center of classical music.

    WHERE YOU’LL CONTRIBUTE

    The Business Intelligence team is IDAGIO’s hub of data on business metrics and the user experience. As such, we collaborate with the product and development teams to design product usage tracking; and with backend and infrastructure engineers to develop the clearest, most reliable reporting possible. With our per-second model of compensating artists and licensers, architecting tracking and reporting systems is a burgeoning and, we find, exciting challenge.

    AS DATA ENGINEER YOU WILL:

    • Architect, build and maintain data pipelines for both internal and external stakeholders
    • Synthesize complex and diverse datasets (user behaviour, revenue streams, etc.) with logic from music licensing contracts to build reporting systems
    • As part of a small but high-visibility team, take on an influential role in architecting our quickly-growing infrastructure and codebase
    • Be a data advocate within the company: define, streamline, and scale data models to promote a data-driven culture

    EXPERIENCE AND PERSONALITY TRAITS WE FIND RELEVANT FOR THIS POSITION

    • 2+ years of experience writing SQL and at least one other programming language (we often use Python)
    • Familiarity with database design principles
    • Experience writing clients for APIs
    • Facility with deriving technical tasks from abstract business questions
    • An eye for both the big picture and the little details: you are equally comfortable architecting systems like a database or a pipeline, or debugging issues on the scale of individual data points
    • An understanding of what makes the structure of classical music unique as compared to other genres is a big plus
    • Clarity, openness, and enthusiasm in communication with colleagues across domains

    WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER

    • Join an exceptional multinational team of 70 and shape the future of classical music
    • Enjoy a positive and purpose-driven working atmosphere in our office in Berlin Kreuzberg
    • Contribute directly to the success of our game-changing product
    • Enjoy flexible working hours, occasional remote work and using the tools and hardware of your choice
    • IDAGIO is well funded by renowned investors such as Tengelmann Ventures, Macquarie Capital and b-to-v
    • A competitive salary and a yearly education budget
    • Sharpen your piano skills on our Steinway Model D, and yes, there is good coffee too
    • We can support you with your Visa process and can answer your questions around relocation. Berlin is a beautiful city with lots to offer.
    Apply for this position

items.content:
Job title: Backend Developer & Data Engineer

Location: London, UK

Salary: £45,000 - £55,000 per annum (permanent or contractor)

Starting Date: Immediate / 17 August 2018

___________________________________________________________________________

About us
We are OpenCapacity, a London-based startup focusing on IoT, Big Data and Applied Machine-Learning for Public Transport. Our platform is the industry’s most advanced real-time capacity forecasting solution for Public Transport. Our focus is on creating truly Intelligent Mobility by applying Machine-Learning and Artificial Intelligence in the public transport sector by generating novel capacity data and connecting this to multiple data sources from operators and cities to deliver increased performance and an enhanced customer experience.

This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a startup as it scales to international markets alongside some of the most recognised players in the field of public transport.

Candidates will need to demonstrate their passion for Cloud Computing, Big Data analytics, and their commitment to developing clear and well-considered ETL pipelines for data-driven solutions.

Who we are looking for
Our Backend Developer & Data Engineer will join a team of IoT hardware, machine learning and web developers, building intelligent mobility management solutions for the public transport market.

You will be working on implementing cloud infrastructure for IoT sensors and Big Data Analytics whilst supporting the growth of our exciting products. You will have responsibility for the technical direction, planning and development of our cloud architecture and data pipelines for data-driven dashboard solutions.

Essential Criteria
-Excellent coding skills in Python
-Proven experience to write reliable, resilient, performant and well-tested code
-Experience with relational (e.g. Postgres, etc) and non-relational databases (indexing, caching, etc); designing schemas
-Strong base in distributed systems, RESTful API design
-Solid experience with cloud computing & services, infrastructure and operations in AWS (EC2, Lambda, etc.) and/or GCP (AppEngine, ComputeEngine, etc.)
-Excellent problem solving and debugging skills
-Self-motivated and pro-active with demonstrated creative and critical thinking capabilities
-Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Desirable Criteria
-Experience with Go, Java
-Some experience with front-end technologies (D3, Django, React, or just vanilla JS)
-Knowledge of machine learning and/or big data analytics
-Tinkering with Computing Hardware (e.g. Raspberry Pis, Jetson TX2s) and Linux environments
-Some experience of mobile apps (iOS and/or Android - or Web App)

Benefits
-Working in fast-paced, cutting-edge, startup environment
-Possibility for remote working or co-working at our London based office situated in Clerkenwell (EC1V)
-Flexibly manage your own time and workflow
-Laptop of your choice
-Free fruit, tea/coffee throughout the week
-Regular networking events, mentoring events and conferences
-Exposure to experts from a number of industries
-Freedom to explore the latest tools and technologies
-Knowledge-sharing activities

Keywords:
Python, Cloud Computing, Data pipelines, Data mining, Machine Learning, Intelligent Mobility, Smart City, Computer Science, UK work permit, London

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: £45,000.00 to £55,000.00 /year

items.content:
Mesosphere (https://mesosphere.com) | Remote | Software Engineers | Full-time

Mesosphere is heavily involved in the development of Apache Mesos with the vision to build an infrastructure to utilize your entire datacenter or cloud instances like one big computer.

In this role there will be a large variety of features to work on, including resource allocation, job scheduling, containerization, provisioning, metrics, logging, task preemption, checkpointing, fault-tolerance, auto-scaling, modularization, testing, and much more. All of these involve modern C++ libraries that facilitate asynchronous I/O handling for distributed computing and make concurrency and manual memory management fun again. As an added bonus, majority of your work will be upstreamed into Apache Mesos project giving your work global visibility and provide an avenue to become a committer of a popular OSS project!

We are hiring in SF, Hamburg (Germany) and Remote.

items.content:
Data Engineer


Auth0


Auth0, a global leader in Identity-as-a-Service (IDaaS), provides thousands of enterprise customers with a Universal Identity Platform for their web, mobile, IoT, and internal applications. Its extensible platform seamlessly authenticates and secures more than 1.5B logins per month, making it loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises. Auth0 has raised more than $110 million to date and continues its global growth at a rapid pace. We are consistently recognized as a great place to work based our outstanding leadership and dedication to company culture, and are looking for the best people to join our incredible team spread across more than 35 countries!

Auth0 is loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises. More than 500,000 unique users visit Auth0.com each month due to our compelling content and the functionality of our identity platform. Our mission is to simplify developers' lives, improve security, and reduce identity TCO for our enterprise customers, by making identity simple, secure and extensible. We strive to maintain a welcoming and inclusive culture built on the principle of "No B.A.P." (No BS, No A-holes, No Internal Work Politics).

As Data Engineer, you will convert the data we process everyday from our users into actionable information to better understand our customers and give them an even better service every day.

Responsibilities:


* Transform data from different data sources to integrate with our Data Warehouse in Redshift.

* Create ETLs to transform that data into usable formats.

* Design and develop reports to help make business decisions.

* Design infrastructure components.

* Integrate to other external systems like Stripe, Zendesk and others.




Skills and Abilities:


* Experience as a Data Engineer.

* Desire to learn about Auth0's business.

* Experience with R and R Studio.

* Experience with SQL, Python and Bash.

* Experience with BI reporting tools like Tableau




Auth0 is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Auth0 conducts all employment-related activities without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, genetics, or status as a Vietnam-era special disabled and other covered veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Auth0 participates in E-Verify and will confirm work authorization for candidates residing in the United States.

items.content:
*Our Purpose*
We’re building the future by developing ground breaking technology that will be fundamental to emerging industries. Industries that we believe will improve the lives of everyone across the world.

*Our Mission & Team*
Located in Shoreditch, London, our exceptional team is creating a digital framework for the physical world, and we're starting with building cloud infrastructure allowing augmented reality content and services to be tied to deeply precise locations. Our company was founded in 2016 and is backed by top European venture funds.

*The Role*
As an SDK developer at Scape Technologies, you will take a key role in designing, developing and distributing the SDK for high accuracy, vision based, global positioning. You will be working closely with the research team to make sure that Scape's proprietary computer vision libraries run efficiently and robustly on a wide variety of devices; for a wide variety of applications.

*Essential Skills*
* BSc in Computer Science or Engineering related field.
* Experience developing for both iOS and Android.
* Strong understanding of low level computation languages (C++, C, Java)
* Proven experience developing and distributing SDK's.
* Many years of experience working in development teams.
* Held a position as lead developer on a project.

*Our Culture*
We’re a visionary young start-up working with the very latest computer vision research, and we’re working hard to build our team with the best industry and academic talent. We need committed self-improvers, who can play key roles in the company’s growth whilst helping to contribute to the team around them. We offer highly competitive salaries and generous equity packages.

Scape Technologies is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

items.content:
Blockchain Developer

Location: Singapore
Role and job type: Engineering Full-time

Job Description

ROLE

Blockchain Developer will be responsible for developing and driving the development of the blockchain infrastructure and lead all the related projects.

This position is for someone who is passionate about potential of blockchain technology to change the industry landscape and how business is done. As a Blockchain Developer you will get at the ground level, driving design and development for the Blockchain infrastructure.

You must have good understanding of the blockchain concept from technology and business application perspective. You should value simplicity and scale, work comfortably in a collaborative, agile environment, and be excited to learn. You will also have the chance to work in other exciting areas such as front-end development, back-end development etc.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Working with a team of expert developers to develop blockchain-based decentralized applications for enterprise use
  • Leading the development of smart contracts and the performance of blockchain integration with existing applications
  • Establishing and maintaining the environments in which blockchain solutions can be implemented, including development, testing, and production environments
  • Maintain a continuous integration pipeline for the development and testing of applications

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Proficiency in English
  • University’s degree in relevant area of study
  • Have a solid grasp of understanding of blockchain, including its dynamic, technology, tools and ecosystem
  • Have experience in developing and deploying smart contract for any popular blockchain
  • Have experience in developing and deploying a full stack application in cloud environment
  • Have experience in any Blockchain platform such as Hyperledger, Ethereum, Multichain, Corda etc
  • Have experience in using following (or similar) protocols such as HTTP, REST JSON, GIT etc.
  • Team player who is comfortable working in a distributed agile team

ADDITIONAL PLUS

  • Familiar with functional programming language such as (or similar) Haskell, Clojure, Node, etc
  • Have an architectural skill in using following (or similar) systems such as CI/CD, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, micro-services
  • Understand DevOps practices, data structures, cryptography and data security
  • Have experience in leading a crypto project and consulting experience therefore have deep understanding of token economics
  • Familiar with Stellar Consensus Protocol

OFFER

  • Salary of SGD 5,000-10,000 / month (depending on experience and qualifications)
  • Attractive equity options and token pool (from ICO) for outstanding candidates
  • Foreign who relocate from most countries do not need to pay their country income tax and for the proposed remuneration income tax in Singapore than 5%
  • Visa sponsorship can be provided to the right candidate

HOW TO APPLY

Please send your CV to careers[at]capital-match[dot]com

Salary range

SGD 5,000 - 10, 000, equity options and token pool for outstanding candidate

items.content:
About Monese

At Monese we believe that access to banking and financial services is a right that everybody should enjoy. We are on a mission to ensure that anyone in the world who needs a bank account can get one. By using leading edge technology via smartphones, we offer services that are easy to access, simple to use and cheap to run for anybody.

The first Monese product already serves hundreds of thousands of customers in the UK and Europe, and we are adding new services on a regular basis.

Our fast growing team is located in London, UK and Tallinn, Estonia. By working with us, you will be part of a carefully selected team who are great at what they do and share the belief in our mission of making banking available to everybody. We’re not just a start-up with an idea; we have a proven business model that is growing exponentially and generates strong revenues.

About the role

We are looking for a Business Analyst who will be the vital link between our information technology capacity and business objectives. In this role you will be working with different teams to define, build and roll-out innovative technology and business processes in fast-paced environment.

Role Specifics:

* Conducting solid and detailed investigation of business needs and designing the best solution in close collaboration with both business and development.
* Defining configuration specifications and business analysis requirements.
* Identifying issues and opportunities, and acting as a bridge between different projects.
* Creating user stories and translate high-level business solutions into technical specifications.
* Ability to work in an agile team with a ‘hands-on’ approach.
* Constantly be on the lookout for ways to improve monitoring, discover issues and deliver better value to the customer.

REQUIREMENTS

What we are looking for:

* Profound experience in business and/or system analysis of complex software systems.
* Solid experience in writing SQL queries.
* Extensive experience with UML modelling.
* Ability to translate ambiguous business requirements into analytical insights.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills (written and verbal).
* Ability to follow a system’s life cycle process.
* Previous experience in Finance would be beneficial.
* Passion for solving complex interaction problems and ability to take charge of your time and meet deadlines.
* Fluent English skills

BENEFITS

Benefits of working at Monese:

* Stock options and competitive salary
* Ample opportunity to develop your career within Monese as you will be an important part of a fast-growing company
* A horizontal structure where everyone has a voice and makes a direct and valued contribution to building the best product possible
* International team of open-minded people
* Opportunity to travel between our offices and meet other teams as well
* Many fun team events, office parties and summer ‘weekend-getaway’ to spend some quality time with your colleagues
* Flexible working schedule and possibility to work remotely

Sounds like something for you?

Please send us your CV and cover letter in English.

We will start reviewing the applications and meeting the candidates immediately, so be quick to apply!

About Monese

At Monese we believe that access to banking and financial services is a right that everybody should enjoy. We are on a mission to ensure that anyone in the world who needs a bank account can get one. By using leading edge technology via smartphones, we offer services that are easy to access, simple to use and cheap to run for anybody.

Monese serves hundreds of thousands of customers in the UK and Europe, and we are adding new services on a regular basis.

Our fast growing team is located in London, UK and Tallinn, Estonia. Back End Data Engineer


Clevertech


## DESCRIPTION:
Clevertech is looking for a Back End Data Engineer to join our global team.
This role has database design and implementation responsibilities including alternative data structures such as nosql, redis, elasticsearch and more. Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code.

You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show you care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like minded individuals.

## REQUIREMENTS:

* 5+ years experience with complex data structures.
* You have deep experience in the latest libraries and programming techniques.
* You have accomplishments that showcase your capabilities by their success and technical depth.
* You own new features from idea to completion.
* Work well with a core team to design and execute major new features.
* Familiar with SQL/NoSQL databases like MongoDB and their declarative query languages is a plus
* Enjoy contributing to a fast moving exciting project
* Strong experience using GitHub in a professional environment
* Strong communicator and fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Thrive and excel in our diverse, distributed and agile team environment

See more jobs at Clevertech

items.content:
*About us:*

Adzuna is a job search engine that lists every job, everywhere. From launch in the UK in 2011, we now have more than 10 million visitors a month and are busy conquering the world from our office in West London. Right now, we're seeking an experienced Perl Developer to join our world class tech team in helping millions of people find better, more fulfilling jobs.

*The role:*

Our engineering and product teams are pivotal to Adzuna's future. It's an exciting time as we scale our existing product offering and also innovate with new tools and user experiences that 'surprise and delight' our audience, like ValueMyCV, which we're really proud of. Our infrastructure is built around industry-standard open-source tools and runs on distributed clusters, supporting 16 internationalised Adzuna websites, as well as the 'Find a job' portal that we run on behalf of the UK Government.

Based in our great Fulham office, (or remotely) you will work with a smart team of back end, dev/ops, data science/machine learning and product specialists, overseeing all aspects of our operations, ranging from powering our international websites, aggregating classifieds from thousands of external sources, to crunching job market data to power our statistics and applying machine learning algorithms to enhance job seekers’ experience.

At Adzuna you will work independently in a fast-moving, low-structure environment where you will have the opportunity to help shape our technical direction and processes as we grow. An appreciation of the ‘DevOps’ movement is essential as we manage and monitor the systems ourselves. Vitally, you’ll value the importance of building structured code that is fast, scalable, reliable and robust.

The projects you will work on will include new search features, relevancy and matching algorithms, APIs and ‘big data’ analysis, reporting tools and features to enhance the job search experience on Adzuna. Our systems have been built to scale, and you will be able to demonstrate your experience in writing scalable code running in distributed environments.

Our opportunity offers the chance to build something to be proud of, whilst becoming a part of one of the fastest growing businesses in Europe. We offer a supportive working environment, with an emphasis on team-working, mentoring and training. It's fun and fast moving. Join us!


*About you:*

We don't like to put people in boxes, but you're likely to be able to demonstrate much of the below:

* Experience in partnering with other developers and data scientists to improve existing systems and develop new functionality and tools
* Able to analyse business and technical requirements and develop solutions, taking into account variable aspects, such as performance, scalability, ease of maintenance and cost.
* Proven ability to help refactor existing processes and workflows to improve efficiency
* Experienced in interested in participating in R&D of new technology trends and tools
* Passion for, or ambition to, assist and mentor other members of our development team


*Technical competency and tools:*

* 4+ years with high-volume/high-traffic applications/sites
* Excellent Object-Oriented Perl, preferably including Moose
* Strong SQL (ideally MySQL) and DBIx::Class
* Experience with unit and functional testing (Test::More etc.)
* Good experience with Unix/Linux
* Version control systems, ideally Git
* Solid understanding of application data flow and lifecycles
* Strong attention to detail



*Useful extra skills / experience:*

* Solr, Lucene, ElasticSearch or other search engine
* Templating frameworks (ideally Template Toolkit)
* Classified ads / vertical search websites
* Varnish, nginx, PSGI/Plack, Apache httpd, FastCGI
* Spidering technology
* Search technology and search engine optimisation
* Cloud infrastructure and tools (AWS preferred)
* Chef (pref), Puppet or an equivalent
* Gearman or other distributed queueing/messaging frameworks
* Unicode and internationalisation
* Machine learning / neural nets
* Python


*What we offer:*

* £30k-£40k if remote
* £50-£60k if based in our London offices
* Stock options
* 25 days holiday
* Cycle to work scheme
* Childcare vouchers
* A positive attitude towards flexible working and parental leave
* A values-based culture
* Company contributory pension scheme
* Huge learning opportunity from smart, experienced colleagues
* Table tennis table and a program of team social events
* Bright, airy office with roof terrace, in the heart of bustling Fulham Broadway


*More about Adzuna:*

Adzuna is a search engine for job ads used by over 10 million visitors per month that aims to list every job, everywhere. We search thousands of websites so our users don't have to, bringing together millions of ads in one place. By providing smarter search options and powerful data about the job market, we give jobseekers the information they need to take control of their careers.

Adzuna.co.uk was founded in 2011 by Andrew Hunter and Doug Monro, formerly of eBay, Gumtree, Qype and Zoopla and is backed by leading Venture Capital firms Passion Capital, LocalGlobe, Index Ventures and Smedvig Capital.

We also supply real-time data to the Number 10 Dashboard and Office for National Statistics labour market indices. In 2018, Adzuna won the contract to run ‘Find a job’, one of the British government’s most used online services.

Adzuna’s mission is to be the best place to start looking for a job. We love using the awesome power of technology to help match people to better, more fulfilling jobs and keep Britain working.

items.content:
Scrapinghub | https://scrapinghub.com | 100% Remote |Full-time | Multiple roles

Scrapinghub is now hiring Python Developers, Data Scientists and Backend Engineers

https://scrapinghub.com/jobs

Quick summary of the open positions:

- Python Developer (scraping): you will be in charge of designing, developing and testing Scrapy web crawlers.

- Backend Engineer: You will develop and grow our Crawling and Extraction services.

- Data Scientist: You will apply your data science and engineering skills to create products based on machine learning, analyze large volumes of complex data, model challenging problems, and develop algorithms to solve our internal and client needs.

About Scrapinghub:We're a fully distributed team with more than 130 Shubbers working from over 30 countries, who are passionate about scraping, web crawling and data science.

You'll have the chance to work on projects that harvest and transfer datasets of thousands of millions of records, as well as build some of the systems that will deliver data to current Fortune 500 companies and the startups that are building great products on top of our stack.

We have a very engineering-driven culture (two engineer-founders) and a great place to work if you're self-directed, curious, and interested in working in open source environments. More on Open Source at Scrapinghub: http://scrapinghub.com/opensource/.

Scrapinghub continues to grow significantly this year and we're looking for great additions to our team. Positions are fulltime (40hours per week) and fully remote.

Interview process: 2 interviews and a technical trial project.

You can apply here: https://scrapinghub.com/jobs

Got questions? Feel free to contact me at jessica@scrapinghub.com

items.content:
Williams PanLab for Precision Psychiatry and Translational Neuroscience | Research Data Analyst and Engineer | Stanford, CA; Remote possible | Full-time, Visa | http://williamspanlab.com/

The PanLab for Precision Psychiatry and Translational Neuroscience is searching for a Research Data Analyst and Engineer to build and improve upon our treatment prediction software pipeline, which will help guide an individual to the depression/anxiety treatment that is most effective for them. Our pipeline is the first of its kind and currently outputs the different ways brain circuitry can become dysfunctional. The candidate will use machine learning and statistical techniques in our large datasets to analyze the outputs of our current pipeline and create new treatment prediction models.

The PanLab is a research group at Stanford University that aims to use brain imaging to improve our understanding and treatment of mental health conditions. Our current projects focus on depression and anxiety, with research that embraces individual differences. We use a variety of tools such as MRI, EEG, behavioral testing, genetics, symptoms, and daily functioning data, in order to match an individual with the best treatment for them, whether that is an antidepressant, psychotherapy, TMS, lifestyle changes, etc.

We are looking for a candidate with strong data analysis and software engineering experience, but no neuroimaging experience is required! As we are a 30-person team of psychiatrists, neuroscientists, doctors, clinical psychologists, and data scientists, the ability to communicate technical ideas across a range of experiences is vital. Most importantly, we seek someone self-motivated, imaginative, and genuinely excited to dig into our datasets and to explore novel, reliable, and effective ways to help individuals suffering from mental illness.

Read more about our research: http://williamspanlab.com/our-research

Our publications: http://williamspanlab.com/publications

Interested? Email us your CV to bstavel@stanford.edu

Diginex | Blockchain startup | Hong Kong | F# devs | Fulltime employees ONSITE preferred, VISA sponsors (for freelancers we might accept part-time and/or remote work, if you prove yourself to be worth it)

We are a blockchain start-up based in Hong Kong. Our business consists of cryptocurrency mining, financial services, Initial Coin Offering (ICO) and blockchain technology consultancy, and software research. Among our products, we are developing an opensource crossplatform multicurrency wallet app for desktop & mobile devices and we have plans to build a cryptocurrency exchange platform. Our goal is to become a legitimate, regulated, go-to global blockchain service provider. Our core values are based on high professional standards, where the ability to work effectively and independently is a must-have.

We are looking for filling several vacancies for the following role in the next few weeks:

F#+Xamarin Developer (no previous blockchain experience required): must be comfortable working with opensource workflows (pullrequests, code review, git, etc). Typescript & selenium experience are a plus.

Work onsite (relocation package is offered) is preferred but not a must. Please send CV and short cover letter to andres.aragoneses at diginex dot com.

Photofeeler (https://www.photofeeler.com) | Software Engineers, Marketing Roles | REMOTE or Onsite near Boulder/Denver, CO

Work for big tech, but secretly dream of being an early engineer at a startup where everything you do really matters?

Photofeeler is a tool for photo feedback, but we're primarily a data science company. We do very sophisticated math in order to maximize the statistical value of small, noisy data samples. Our company is changing the future of online profiles.

We're early into building our team but much farther into building our business. This makes us a really exciting place to work.

Our job offers unparalleled freedom without bureaucratic nonsense (think: can work remote, work flexible hours, no unnecessary meetings). Plus our users are eager and enthusiastic for everything we ship. As an early employee, you'll take part in the ongoing conversations that inform the direction of the company.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=12, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=13, bigdata-ml=10, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
Generalist with can-do attitude required to join an exciting early stage startup building wearable technology to disrupt the events space.

Do you like integrating technologies that link the world together? Do you dream about real-world experience building large-scale applications connecting people and devices together using a variety of technologies? Are you motivated by working in a fast-paced dynamic environment?

We’re looking for a UK-based very hands-on Senior Software Engineer / Technical + Team Lead to join and help manage our 100% remote team and evolve our product.

Role Requirements

  • Good fundamental Computer Science knowledge (graph theory, matrix operations, etc)
  • Comfortable wearing Research, Development, and Operations hats in parallel
  • Architecting and building modern scalable mobile, front and back end environments
  • Familiarity with operational concerns (engineering-for-failure, scalability, performance)
  • Building systems in a mix of languages
  • Operating almost 100% remotely
  • Working with a 100% remote team across a variety of cultures and timezones
  • Excellent written and oral skills in both technical and colloquial English

Desired Technical Skills

  • Experience of using Bluetooth / BLE networking technologies (e.g. iBeacon, Eddystone, etc)
  • Experience using hosted systems like AWS and Heroku
  • Good Python ability (e.g. Jupyter, Numpy, Pandas) for basic matrix operations and data analysis
  • Good understanding of data analytics, methods, and tooling for real-time report generation
  • Good Node.js ability (e.g. building APIs)
  • Document oriented databases (ideally Mongo)
  • Understanding how to package an embedded mobile SDK and the support ecosystem that goes with it

Optional Technical Skills

  • Good understanding of mobile application development & deployment systems
  • Real-world understanding of modern message passing architectures and brokers (AMQP)
  • Orchestration & deployment of production / development environments to multiple cloud platforms
  • Cybersecurity, privacy and compliance, and infrastructure resiliency

Distinct Advantages

  • Experience with Machine Learning techniques
  • Knowledge of Graph Database technologies
  • Experience successfully working with remote teams

Culture and Personality

  • Commitment to others within a cohesive team
  • Solution-focused, consultative and comfortable working in a fluid environment
  • Curious and eager to pick up new technologies and languages quickly
  • Enjoys solving complex problems through creative thinking
  • Very comfortable working in a flexible, output-driven culture
  • Self-directed, nimble and proactive - constantly connecting dots and thinking of the next step
  • Thrives in a diverse, dynamic, and collaborative team
  • Able and willing to challenge thinking across all levels of the business
  • Loves to document

About Hiver

Hiver is a London-based tech startup using wearable technology to help event marketers measure and improve engagement at their events. It also helps event attendees remember every contact they meet and quickly follow-up and further connect. Hiver combines the physical event experience with the digital smart networking technology experience.

Hiver has been featured Forbes, The Financial Times, and Thrive Global; and has also won Best New Event Tech by Exhibition News. If you’re interested in the position, send a note to hello@hivertech.com with your LinkedIn profile/CV with the subject line “Senior Software Engineer / Technical + Team Lead”

Learn more about Hiver at www.hivertech.com No agencies, please.

items.content:
Shopify Selling Expert


Salehoo.com

Doubledot Media is a New Zealand-based company creating online tools and training for people looking to start their own online businesses. We’re based in Christchurch, but the majority of our team work remotely from various places around the world.

We have a full-time Shopify Selling Expert position available to work with us at [SaleHoo.com](https://www.salehoo.com/) (Doubledot in the parent company).

SaleHoo is a carefully curated directory of over 8,000 drop ship and wholesale suppliers. Our customers use our directory as a safer and easier way to find wholesale suppliers for goods to sell on eBay, Amazon or in their own stores.

Our new Shopify Selling Expert will play a vital role in creating dropship selling case studies/videos, selling product on Shopify, providing guidance to members through webinars and generally making sure our members receive all the help and expert advice we can give them.

We're looking for someone with great (written and on-screen) people skills, a fair amount of cleverness, the ability to Get Things Done, and a genuine desire to help the good people of the internet succeed.

**You'll be responsible for:**
* Researching profitable niche ideas and sourcing suppliers for specific products.
* Handling Shopify listings via AliExpress and marketing products on Facebook/social media.
* Running fortnightly webinars with our users to help answer questions they may have and educating them on product sourcing and Shopify selling.
* Solving technical problems the customer might be having with their accounts or product sourcing.
* Creating practical case studies of the process that is taken from product sourcing to selling on Shopify.

**You'll need:**
* An excellent understanding of selling on Shopify and experience working to get a product launched, working with Shopify on issues, and marketing and promoting products.
* Excellent written and spoken English and a friendly manner.
* Meticulous attention to detail. Your spelling and grammar should be top notch.
* Empathy and patience to deal with customers with different backgrounds and levels of technical ability. You'll be clear, patient and pleasant.
* Good time management skills. Since this is a remote working position, you'll need to be organized, motivated, and (dare we say) a "self-starter".
* A background in selling online, or experience in the drop shipping industry is required.

This is the perfect position for someone who is knowledgeable and experienced with Shopify and AliExpress, loves educating people, is team oriented and a positive person.

**Neat things about working with us:**
* Flexible hours (can discuss fulltime, contract, inhouse or parttime)
* Work from home, coffee shop or co-op space.
* Relaxed, ego-free, family-friendly work culture
* Need a few more reasons? [Read what current and former staff have to say](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Doubledot-Media-Reviews-E1029356.htm)...

Requirements

We're going to level with you here: We usually get a lot of applications, and a lot of them are not very inspiring.We're looking for people with good problem-solving skills, good communication skills, and the willingness to go the extra mile, so here’s what you need to do.* Record a short (1-2 minute) cover letter video and upload it somewhere where we can see it. Tell us a little bit about yourself, and why you think you’d be great for this role. Please include a link/reference to any Shopify stores you have created (if you haven't created any the position is likely not for you).* Create an email for jobs@doubledotmedia.com (Subject: Shopify Selling Expert Position)* Give us the link to your video (YouTube, Vimeo etc.) inside the email.* Attach your CV/resume in PDF format and send it.

See more jobs at Salehoo.com

items.title: Software Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
One in five households in the UK live in social housing, a sector with the right values at its core but that has historically struggled to deploy innovations in the home. Many residents still can’t afford to heat their homes and live in cold, mouldy properties they can’t be proud of. At Switchee, we believe that everyone deserves to live in a decent home and that the environments we inhabit have a massive influence on our ability to enjoy life and prosper.

We may be only three years old, but it’s already been quite a ride! Our first product, the internet connected Switchee thermostat is already in 35 of the biggest housing providers in the UK. We’re growing 100% year on year and are backed by some of the best-known investors in technology and social impact.

To strengthen our small team of 15 passionate and ambitious people we are looking for an outstanding individual to join us as

*Software* *Engineer*

We are driven by a collective desire to make a positive impact in the housing sector, both for residents and landlords, so your commitment to our values and mission are paramount.



*Your* *responsibilities*

As Software Engineer you’ll be at the forefront of the next stage of the Switchee platform as enter an exciting period of growth. As a start-up this role will involve working in all areas of the platform: frontend, backend, data analytics and more.

* Help design and implement scalable cloud-based solutions for the Switchee platform
* Creating internal and external API’s for our hardware, web apps and partners
* Developing responsive and engaging web applications
* Building out the next version of our real-time streaming analytics system
* Support the product team with user testing and development feedback
* Collaborate with our Firmware team to ensure our hardware and software work seamlessly


*Your* *Experience*

We firmly believe extraordinary people can come from a wide range of places – but we wouldn’t be surprised if the person who gets this role has:

* Experience working with IoT device
* Knowledge of Event sourcing and Domain Driven Design patterns
* Devops, infrastructure as code
* Containers and/or Serverless


*You*

We are a diverse bunch of people at Switchee. That said, there are some characteristics we always look for:

* You deeply care about Switchee’s mission; you have a desire to build something revolutionary, that will disrupt an industry, and positively impact ordinary people’s lives.
* You care about the environment, are interested in energy efficiency and have thought about the challenges and opportunities posed by an evolving domestic energy market
* You like technology and neat solutions to complex problems
* You thrive on challenge and change; you naturally gravitate to the hardest questions first and love thinking differently to solve them.
* You are biased towards action and you’re happiest when you’re ‘getting stuff done’.
* You’re open, positive & straightforward. You’re not afraid to stand up for your convictions, even when it’s hard to do so.
* You delight in your colleagues’ successes and thrive on your failures; you grasp any opportunity for learning and constantly seek to improve.


*Our* *mission*

We believe that radical innovation in internet connected technology can ensure that every resident, every day, is living in a home that allows them to succeed. That’s why our products are built not just on great technology, but on an understanding of what people want from the space they live in.

This approach led us to reimagine the most mundane household object, a thermostat, into a product that automagically reduces energy bills, looks great and offers control to those who want it.

We are also revolutionising the way social landlords manage their housing stock with an obsessively tailored SAAS property dashboard and handy alerts on things like when the boiler is going to break.

Our next project is to build the ultimate connected hub for the social home. It’s going to revolutionise the way residents interact with their properties and landlords manage their homes.



*Life* *at* *Switchee*

We like to keep things simple and flexible at Switchee and consider you to be joining our family. We don’t currently track holidays so you’re free to take as much as you need. We occasionally work remotely but are sensitive to the needs of our colleagues.

We socialise together with regular outings in London and an annual “working remotely” trip where you have the option (but not obligation) to join us in working from a fun location.

If we end up working together, we can offer a competitive salary and a generous stake in the company.

If you believe in the same things, don’t hesitate any longer, apply now! Please be in touch soon as we’ll proceed once the right person is found. If you’d like to apply please submit a CV and cover letter by clicking the button below.

items.title: Data Science Python Developer for Electricity Data Intelligence Start-up
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=40, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=58, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
*About Voltaware*

Voltaware is a dynamic London-based start-up at the forefront of energy monitoring and electricity usage itemisation.

We’re developing machine learning algorithms and building UX optimised interfaces to deliver real data insights to business and domestic users.


*The Team*

You’ll be joining an international team of entrepreneurs, engineers and designers with a history of successful application development and an enthusiasm for innovation and developing cutting edge applications.

We are looking for a Data Science Python Developer to create and manage solutions that turn data into knowledge. You will help us build leading-edge analytics solutions to solve big-data business cases for energy monitoring.

You will be at the forefront of research and development on one of the most challenging problems technologies companies are facing today. Energy monitoring and disaggregation can unlock unparalleled levels of visibility and insight into energy management and consumer behaviour.

Join us for a journey instead of a job!


*Responsibilities*

* Write well designed, efficient code using best software development practices to build and enhance our data science services
* Liaise with our Data Science team to integrate models into end-user applications
Implement data models and techniques developed by colleagues
* Suggest best practices, tools and methodologies for big-data and data-science solutions
* Design, develop and implement proof of concept and production-ready middleware and back-end services either stand-alone or to be consumed by other applications/layers


*Requirements*

* Background in data science
Extensive knowledge of multi-paradigm programming (OO, functional, procedural)
*Python, dask, Tornado, Cassandra, Spark, DynamoDB, RESTful services, pub/sub, Amazon AWS, Linux/Unix, TDD, Virtualenv
*Experience and knowledge of distributed systems and microservices architectures
*Have designed and implemented scalable, distributed application systems
*Problem solving, complexity analysis and algorithm design
*Strong oral and written communication skills are essential!


*Preferred Experience:*

* Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Software Engineering or related, or 5 years of equivalent work experience
* Knowledge of Functional Programming a plus
* MQTT, RabbitMQ or Redis
* Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment a plus
* Stability and Capacity patterns a big plus
* Have worked with international and remote teams


In addition to your CV, please submit the answer to the following question:

What excites you about working in a start-up?

items.title: Senior Software Engineer / Technical + Team Lead
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=12, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=13, bigdata-ml=10, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
*Senior Software Engineer / Technical + Team Lead*
Generalist with can-do attitude required to join an exciting early stage startup building wearable technology to disrupt the events space.

Do you like integrating technologies that link the world together? Do you dream about real-world experience building large-scale applications connecting people and devices together using a variety of technologies? Are you motivated by working in a fast-paced dynamic environment?

We’re looking for a UK-based very hands-on Senior Software Engineer / Technical + Team Lead to join and help manage our 100% remote team and evolve our product.

*Role Requirements*
Good fundamental Computer Science knowledge (graph theory, matrix operations, etc)
Comfortable wearing Research, Development, and Operations hats in parallel
Architecting and building modern scalable mobile, front and back end environments
Familiarity with operational concerns (engineering-for-failure, scalability, performance)
Building systems in a mix of languages
Operating almost 100% remotely
Working with a 100% remote team across a variety of cultures and timezones
Excellent written and oral skills in both technical and colloquial English

*Desired Technical Skills*
Experience of using Bluetooth / BLE networking technologies (e.g. iBeacon, Eddystone, etc)
Experience using hosted systems like AWS and Heroku
Good Python ability (e.g. Jupyter, Numpy, Pandas) for basic matrix operations and data analysis
Good understanding of data analytics, methods, and tooling for real-time report generation
Good Node.js ability (e.g. building APIs)
Document oriented databases (ideally Mongo)
Understanding how to package an embedded mobile SDK and the support ecosystem that goes with it

*Optional Technical Skills*
Good understanding of mobile application development & deployment systems
Real-world understanding of modern message passing architectures and brokers (AMQP)
Orchestration & deployment of production / development environments to multiple cloud platforms
Cybersecurity, privacy and compliance, and infrastructure resiliency

*Distinct Advantages*
Experience with Machine Learning techniques
Knowledge of Graph Database technologies
Experience successfully working with remote teams

*Culture and Personality*
Commitment to others within a cohesive team
Solution-focused, consultative and comfortable working in a fluid environment
Curious and eager to pick up new technologies and languages quickly
Enjoys solving complex problems through creative thinking
Very comfortable working in a flexible, output-driven culture
Self-directed, nimble and proactive - constantly connecting dots and thinking of the next step
Thrives in a diverse, dynamic, and collaborative team
Able and willing to challenge thinking across all levels of the business
Loves to document


*About Hiver*
Hiver is a tech startup using wearable technology to help event marketers measure and improve engagement at their events by enabling event attendees to remember every contact they meet and quickly connect with those they find valuable. It connects the physical with the digital networking experience through intelligent technology. Hiver has been featured Forbes and The Financial Times and has also won Best New Event Tech by Exhibition News.

If you’re interested, send a note to hello@hivertech.com with your LinkedIn profile/CV with the subject line “Senior Software Engineer / Technical + Team Lead”

No agencies, please.

items.title: Data Analyst & Dashboard Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=24, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=13, embedded=0, frontend=17}
items.content:
*SOLVING THE PROBLEM OF FOOD WASTE*

OLIO is the world’s only neighbour-to-neighbour food sharing app, and our mission is to solve the problem of food waste in the home & local community. We do this by connecting anyone with spare food – which can be households or local businesses – with neighbours living nearby who would like it. Globally, over one third of all the food we produce gets thrown away, which is worth over $1 trillion. What few people realise however is that in the developed world, over half of all food waste takes place in the home, with the average UK family throwing away £800 of food each year - collectively adding up to £15bn. OLIO solves this with our award-winning mobile & web apps. Over the past 2 years OLIO has grown from a local initiative in North London to a global movement.

We now have over 465,000 users who have together shared well over half a million portions of food – with food being successfully shared in 32 countries and counting. Underpinning this incredible growth has been our volunteer programme, with over 19,000 people reaching out to spread the word about OLIO in their local community and rescue unsold food.

OLIO is now looking to grow our core team as we embark upon the next exciting phase in our journey.

*JOIN OUR TEAM!*

In order to accelerate OLIO to its next level in growth and impact, we are recruiting for a Data Analyst & Dashboard Developer, who will report into Viv Taylor, Product Manager.

In this role you will be responsible for:

* Data Analysis: Analysing key business questions in our burgeoning data via an SQL interface (both through
GUI and command line tools)
* Data Visualization: Development of a “data dashboard” for the company to help us interrogate our data
visually and in a user friendly manner
* Data Innovation: Liaison with our broader OLIO team to ensure that the right questions are being asked of
our growing datasets, in the right order.
* Data Exploration: Evaluation of the effects of specific initiatives/experiments at OLIO, generating and
presenting reports of their efficacy
* Setup of regular reports that provide insight into ongoing company/departmental performance.
* Assisting with online ad creative endeavours, their implementation and analysing their impact

Once you have proven yourself you will have great freedom and autonomy, coupled with an enormous opportunity for personal development. All of our roles are remote working roles, however for London based team members
there is the ability to co-work as well. We live for our mission, but like to have fun along the way!

*IS THIS YOU?*

Our ideal candidate will first and foremost be as passionate about our mission as we are! In addition to this, you will have the following experience and skills:

* Significant prior experience with SQL and RDBMS.
* Experience with Web Development and Visualization Tools, preferably with experience of relevant
JavaScript libraries (such as D3, jQuery, Bootstrap) and knowledge web models (e.g. LAMP)
* Experience of image processing software (e.g. Photoshop/GIMP)
* Excitement about Productivity Tools and Data Science.
* Curiosity about and enthusiasm for systems and processes
* Scrappy and resourceful when facing challenges of all types
* An eye for detail

*Bonus points:*

* You have experience working for a high-growth startup
And all OLIO team members share these attributes:
* A self-starter with a ‘can-do’ attitude
* Resourceful and creative
* Thorough, but able to move quickly and decisively
* A ruthless ability to prioritise
* Excellent communication skills
* Fun to work with :)
